results.name: Riordan array (1/(1+x),x/(1-x)).
comment: Row sums are A078008. Diagonal sums are A078024. Inverse is A112466. Note that C(n,k) = sum{j = 0..n-k, C(j+k-1,j)}.
Central coefficients T(2n, n) are A072547. - _Paul Barry_, Apr 08 2011

formula: Number triangle T(n, k) = sum{j = 0..n-k, C(j+k-1, j)*(-1)^(n-k-j)}.
T(n, 0) = (-1)^n, T(n, n) = 1, T(n+1, k) = T(n, k-1) + T(n, k), 0 < k < n. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jan 03 2014

exp(x) * e.g.f. for row n = e.g.f. for diagonal n. For example, for n = 3 we have exp(x)*(-1 + x + x^2/2! + x^3/3!) = -1 + 2*x^2/2! + 6*x^3/3! + 13*x^4/4! + .... The same property holds more generally for Riordan arrays of the form ( f(x), x/(1 - x) ). - _Peter Bala_, Dec 21 2014
